definition: eloquent person/person with rhetoric skills
to dispute/to debate/to argue/to discuss
surname Shi
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: O let my looks be then the eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 哦，请让我的诗篇做我的辩士。

sentences.english: Where is the philosopher of this age?
where is the disputer of this world?

definition: (loanword) pence/penny
School of Diplomacy of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC) whose leading advocates were Su Qin 蘇秦|苏秦[Su1 Qin2] and Zhang Yi 張儀|张仪[Zhang4 Yi2]
virtuous person/a man of merit
Gongsun Long (c. 325-250 BC), leading thinker of the School of Logicians of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
eloquence
Su Qin (340-284 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
strategist/counsellor on military strategy
Hui Shi, also known as Hui-zi 惠子[Hui4 zi5](c. 370-310 BC), politician and philosopher of the School of Logicians 名家 [Ming2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
skilled manipulator/tactician/strategist/advisor/counsellor
imperial strategic adviser/expert on strategy
Lord Menchang of Qi, Chancellor of Qi and of Wei during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
Han Feizi, book of Legalist Philosophy authored by Han Fei 韓非|韩非[Han2 Fei1] during the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
Zhang Yi (-309 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
Deng Xi (545-501 BC), Chinese philosopher and rhetorician, the first lawyer of ancient China
famous scholar/worthy/celebrity, esp. distinguished literary person having no official post
Yanzi (-c 500 BC), famous statesman from Qi of the Warring States, also known as 晏子, hero of book 晏子春秋
